refnamediv.refpurpose: Reports whether setuid programs are honored in a cell

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The fs getcellstatus command reports whether the Cache Manager allows programs fetched from each specified cell to run with setuid permission. To set a cell's setuid status, use the fs setcell command; fs_setcell(1) fully describes how AFS treats setuid programs.

listitem.para: Names each cell for which to report setuid status. Provide the fully qualified domain name, or a shortened form that disambiguates it from the other cells listed in the local /usr/vice/etc/CellServDB file.
Prints the online help for this command. All other valid options are ignored.

refsect1.title: Output
refsect1.para: The output reports one of the following two values as appropriate:
refsect1.programlisting: Cell <cell> status: setuid allowed Cell <cell> status: no setuid allowed

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following example indicates that programs from the cell abc.com are not allowed to run with setuid permission.
refsect1.programlisting: % fs getcellstatus abc.com Cell abc.com status: no setuid allowed
